Question: It involves eliciting information from the customer about the work environment, or domain, in which the final product will function in life cycle.
It is the first activity that has a high-level decomposition of the system into components that can either be brought in from existing software products or be developed from scratch independently.
It is an architectural design that provides a decomposition of the system description that allows for isolated development of seperate components which will later be integrated.
It is a detailed design for a component of the system should be in such a form that it is possible to implement it in some executable programming language.
It is once enough components have been implemented and individually tested, they must be integrated as described in the architectural design.
It is all work on the system is considered under the category of maintenance, until such time as a new version of the product demands a total redesign or the product is phased out entirely
It is the ultimate test of usability based on measurement of user experience. It demands that specific usability measures be made explicit as requirements
4 Specifications of Usability
CorrectAnswer: Usability Attribute/Principle, Measuring Concept, Measuring Method, New Level/Worst Case/Planned Level/BestCase

Question: It is a usability specification that requires level of detail that may not be possible early in design satisfying a usability specification does not necessarily satisfy usability
It overcomes inherent problems of incomplete requirements
4 management issues in Iterative design
Four Main Phases in Software Process + the Iteration Loop that is focused on the design of interaction
CorrectAnswer: What is wanted, Analysis, Design, Prototype, Implement and Deploy

Question: It is the first stage in four main phases of software process that is establishing what exactly is needed

The last phase in 4 main phase of Software Cycle that after the design, it is needed to be create and deploy. It involves writing code, documentations and manual
This is a collection of processess, which focus on putting users at the center of the product

This is an iterative design process in which designers and other stakeholders focus on the users and their needs in each phase of the design process. This calls for involving users throughout the design process
Users should be able to see from the beginning what they can do with the product, what is it about, how they can use it.
Users should be able to find information easily and quickly.
Text should be easy to read and understand.
Short sentences are preferred here.
A quest to find the best possible match between the user's mental model that they have in their mind, and the conceptual model that you're presenting to them with your product.

This refers to a user's underlying expectations about how something should work. It is formed based on what they already do, prior experiences with similar products, or by assumptions they've made based on how it appears
This is constantly evolving and subject to change. It is influenced by new experiences with your product, other technologies, and day to day life.
This is created by the designer as a high-level plan for how the product will work and fit together.
This refers to the structure and grouping of Information within the product
These are the guiding concepts or rules for the types of content appearing on each page
This refers to creating consistent, continuous, or complementary experiences?
This refers to the usage of well-known patterns and conventions and the interaction of the users to the system.
This refers to a rhetorical device in which a word or phrase literally denoting one kind of object or idea is used in place of another to suggest a likeness or analogy between them.'

This states that an interface should implemented behavior from system that the users are familiar with. It increases the understandability of even most complex application by introducing the element of being familiar with the environment user has been working.
This metaphor focuses on justice, equilibrium, and the interplay of elements
This metaphor includes changes in substance and circumstances
This metaphor involves the meeting of past, presetn and future.
This metaphor involves encompassing inclusion, exclusion, states of being, and other boundaries
This metaphor focuses on the need to relate to oneself and others
This metaphor involves acquisitions and their consequences
This metaphor involves the sense of mastery, vulnerability, and well-being
